Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= generic term for clothing
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
literally: (one's) name is called (over someone); hence: = state in which a person or building is closely associate to another person or a deity
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= action by which someone brings an event to an end
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: sprout; hence: = a new member of a royal dynasty, ◄ compared to a new branch that sprouts from a tree
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which something is beautiful and attractive to look at
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
literally: fruit; hence: = products of the land, ◄ depicted as fruit; ≈ regarded as a blessing from God

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= state in which humans, animals, plants, or objects remain in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative action by which humans write down names or other information for record keeping purposes, without an explicit reference to a scroll or other writing materials

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: holy; hence: = state in which people have separated themselves from others ► in order to live their life in conformity to God's commandments

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to take a bath|to bathe|to wash
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: excrement; hence: = filthy substance; ► which renders people dirty and unclean; ≈ associated with sinfulness
plural only: = villages or small towns that are considered part of the territory of a larger town or nation, referred to as the daughters of that larger town or nation
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative process by which someone uses water to remove dirt, stains, or any other impurity from an object
= a spiritual entity coming over humans and triggering attitudes corresponding to its character and purpose
= action by which humans or deities carry out a verdict pronounced against an individual or group
= a spiritual entity coming over humans and triggering attitudes corresponding to its character and purpose

Node.gloss: to sweep away|to put away|to get rid of|to do away with|to remove|to clear out|to purge|to destroy
Node.definition: = action by which someone makes sure that a certain object is no longer found anywhere at all, ◄ as if it were completely consumed by fire
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a firm location, suitable for building upon; ≈ often used for the place where the temple of God was built
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
literally: proclamation; hence: = event when people are called together for a religious ceremony, usually during a festival
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= during the daytime
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= process by which a phenomenon manifests itself as a kind of covering in a certain area ► and provides protection to those who are under its influence

= a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone
= during the daytime
= state of high temperature during the day; ◄ caused by the heat of the sun; ≈ regarded as uncomfortable
= location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances
= a place where humans and animals can find protection against the forces of nature
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
